(It's extremely late my time, so I'm going to make this short. Good 
night^_^)

Tavatron growled in anger and returned as much of Dark One's fire as 
possible. This was getting out of hand. Her sensors were inoperable, Dinobot 
was severely injured, and they were still miles from the base. All she could 
do was hope they could hold out long enough for help to arrive, that is if 
they even noticed they were missing.

Hiss's shots catch Tavatron off-gaurd, sending her into a roll that ended 
with her sprawled a few feet from her previous location. She quickly righted 
herself, paying her scorched armor no attention as she concentrated on the 
battle before her.

Tavatron was trained for close combat, and wouldn't last long in a 
long-range battle. The enemy had to get closer, then she could do some real 
damage. Until then her only weapons were her optic lasers. Tavatron 
continued to charge and fire multiiple energy bolts at the approching enemy, 
all the while wondering if Dinobot was allright .She didn't know exactly how 
much fluid he had lost, but judging from the amount that covered his 
chest-plate he had been bleeding for quite a while.

Tavatron snarled under her breath as she waited for the arrival of help, or 
more enemies. There was one thing she was sure of, she had not intention of 
dying today, or of letting Dinobot throw his life away in an attempt to save 
hers. This was as much her battle as it was his, and though she greatly 
appreciated and often times welcomed his help, when it came down to it she 
could hold her own.
